Key Match Events: Klay Thompson started the game with eight points, three rebounds, and one assist in seven minutes, helping the Mavericks take a 30-24 lead after the first quarter.
Thompson struggled in the second quarter, committing two turnovers and not adding to his totals as the Mavericks trailed 61-52 at halftime.
In the third quarter, Thompson started but struggled defensively, leading to substitutions. He had two points and two rebounds in the quarter as the Mavericks faced an 89-75 deficit.
Thompson started the fourth quarter with back-to-back 3-pointers to give the Mavericks a lift, but the Rockets ultimately won 110-99.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dallas Mavericks have struggled since Luka Doncic strained his left calf against the Minnesota Timberwolves on Christmas, with three straight losses.
Klay Thompson has been inefficient since Doncic's injury, shooting 4-for-8 against the Rockets after being 7-for-24 from deep in his previous three games.
Kyrie Irving has also faced defensive challenges, scoring 16 points against the Rockets despite a strong performance against the Portland Trail Blazers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a road game for the Dallas Mavericks.
The Houston Rockets ranked second in defensive rating and effectively defended against Kyrie Irving.
